intro: Brachypodium arbuscula, commonly known as the little grass or dwarf brome, is a small annual grass species native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters and has narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, pale green spikelets that contain three to five flowers, which are wind-pollinated. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as rocky soils and disturbed areas. Brachypodium arbuscula is often used in ecological studies due to its adaptability and role in soil stabilization.
